metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4330 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the HDF5 1.8.16 library's failure to check if the number of dimensionsfor an array read from the file is within the bounds of the space allocatedfor it, a heap-based buffer overflow will occur, potentially leading toarbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
hdf5-tools - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-cpp-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-java - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-mpich-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-openmpi-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5').
